page.title: 20Bayford Area-Final Thoughts
page.content: We were pleased to be allocated this pleasant{rural area,}which most of the survey team knew little about. The survey has enabled us to talk to local residents, and we wish to thank them for their interest and cooperation. In 1086, both were small 'tuns', and we were struck by the fact that they are still{small, peaceful communities. Despite the few amenities, local residents seemed to appreciate the advantages of rural life. ______________________________________ {Richard Hale Survey Team Appleton D.,Archer G.,Arkley M.,Cox T. Barnes M.,Bossley M.,Brennan S.,Gill P Clement J.,Clift B.,Cooper T.,Davies A De Comarmond M.,Evans C.,Fearfield P., Gorin M.,Gray M.,Highman P.,Lawrence G Martin I.,Minty A.,Morris P,O'Reilly F Parker C.,Patrick J.,Pollit M.,Pratt S Gandee D.,Wells M.,Wyatt G.
